Introducing The Odin, a modern, modular puzzle toy

View Our Kickstarter

The Odin: Functional and beautiful.
No compromises.


View More x

A Part of Your Home

Dogs don't care how their toys look, they just want to play. So why not make a beautiful dog toy, something that complements your home? With this in mind and other ideas on improving our dog's favorite toys, we created The Odin, a puzzle treat toy that is beautiful for your home and fun for your dog.


View More x

Modern puzzle toy

Our dog's favorite kind of toy is the puzzle toy and we think it'll be your dog's favorite too. The Odin engages dogs on multiple levels, giving them mental stimulation and physical activity. It's also a type of toy that dogs don't lose interest in. If your dog enjoys food, they will enjoy The Odin.


View More x

Modular

Multiple toys can be connected like Lego blocks to add variation and increase difficulty. With multiple toys, they will not roll as easily and more treats can be held, extending the amount of time your dog will play without refilling. If the toy gets old you can add more toys or change treats to keep your dog interested.

A Toy For Every Dog and Every Home

The Odin's minimal, modern design is inspired by geometric shapes and art. After many drawings, CADs, paper and 3D printed prototypes we created a durable, beautiful and extremely functional shape.

It features flaps to easily place treats in, differently sized holes to let varying treat sizes fall out and is big enough to not be swallowed by big dogs but light enough to be pushed around by small dogs.

View our Kickstarter

Corgi BreakSmile

View our Kickstarter

Is This Toy Right For Your Dog?

How tough is The Odin?

It's tough! Our dog chews up all his toys so we stopped buying him soft toys and in the same vein, designed The Odin to withstand his strong bite. We selected a material called TPE/TPR, which is a soft, food safe plastic because Odin's most durable toys use that material as well.

We encourage you to watch your dog and to guide him/her as they play though. Although The Odin can withstand chewing, it is not meant to be a chew toy.

What's the benefit of having 2 or more Odin toys?

Connecting additional toys keeps The Odin interesting and challenging, making your dog play with it longer. When just one Odin is used, it rolls around in all directions. When two or more Odins are connected, it does not roll as easily and is harder to pick up so your dog will have to play with it differently.

Additionally, you can put more kibble or treats into The Odin when you have multiple or fill many Odins separately so your dog can play with one and when finished switch to the next.

Giving back to our dogs

Big ears and big heart

Ever since our dog, Odin, came into our lives, heâ€™s shared his innate happiness with everyone who encounters him. More people know his name than ours and we're known as "the couple with the corgi." The joy he so easily spreads inspired us to start Up Dog Toys with a mission to make happy dogs and happy dog owners.

In the same way that Odin makes everyone's day better, we hope our products will make you and your dog's day better too.

Guiding principles:

  • Happy dogs and happy humans
  • The best toys are the ones that are played with often
  • Build relationships with customers
  • Design for beauty and functionality
  • Have fun
